title: Eggs in Purgatory
introduction: Eggs in Purgatory, or Uova in Purgatorio, is a traditional Neapolitan dish that transforms simple pantry ingredients into a hearty, satisfying meal. The combination of eggs poached in a spicy tomato sauce with a touch of basil or oregano gives it a deep, rich flavor. Perfect with crusty bread, this dish is quick to prepare and perfect for any time when you need a warm, comforting meal.
ingredients: 4 fresh basil leaves, torn into pieces, or a pinch of dried oregano
instructions: Pour the oil into a medium skillet. Add the onion and cook over medium heat, stirring, until tender and golden, about 10 minutes. Add the tomatoes, basil, red pepper, and salt to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook 15 minutes or until thickened.
Break an egg into a small cup. With a spoon, make an indentation in the tomato sauce. Slide the egg into the sauce. Continue with the remaining eggs.
Cover the skillet and cook until the eggs are set to taste, 2 to 3 minutes. Serve hot.
